item.title: Skirk Constellation Guide In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Skirk

Cryo

Sword

Region

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Skirk is a playable 5-star character in Genshin Impact . To obtain her, players have to wish on her Void Star’s Advent banner. She’s a strong DPS, even at her C0, and players can wish for more to increase her Constellations. This guide will go through Skirk’s Constellations in Genshin Impact and rank their importance in combat.

Are Skirk’s Constellations Worth It In Genshin Impact?

Yes, Skirk Constellations are worth it in Genshin Impact . All of Skirk’s Constellations are straight to the point by adding extra DMG and ATK% to her combat abilities. While there’s nothing groundbreaking going to change in her gameplay, the extra numbers she gets from each constellation are really high. For players who are considering going for Skirk’s Constellations, go for her first two, as they add enough DMG to set her apart from all the other C0 Skirk in Genshin Impact .

Skirk Constellations In Genshin Impact

C1 - Far to Fall

Effect

Enhances the effects of the Passive Talent Reason Beyond Reason: Every Void Rift absorbed will summon a crystal blade to attack nearby opponents, dealing 500% of Skirk's ATK as Cryo DMG. This DMG is considered Charged Attack DMG.

You must first unlock the Passive Talent Reason Beyond Reason.

Importance

High

C1 Skirk gets the ability to deal extra DMG to enemies when absorbing her Void Rifts, which is something easy for her. Her entire gameplay revolves around having her team set the Void Rifts ready for Skirk to absorb them when she starts attacking. The only downside is that this Constellation’s DMG scales with Charged Attack DMG, which is not something the 5-star Cryo unit scales with.

C2 - Into the Abyss

Effect

After unleashing her Elemental Skill Havoc: Warp, Skirk will gain 10 additional Serpent's Subtlety points.

When using her Elemental Burst Havoc: Ruin, the DMG of this Elemental Burst instance will be increased by taking up to 10 more Serpent's Subtlety points into account.

Additionally, within 12.5s after Skirk unleashes the special Elemental Burst Havoc: Extinction while in her Seven-Phase Flash mode, her ATK is increased by 70%. This effect will be canceled when she leaves the Seven-Phase Flash mode.

Importance

High

C2 Skirk can stay on the field for a longer duration while dealing more DMG. Not only that, but when players cast Skirk’s special Elemental Burst while she’s in her Seven-Phase Flash state, she will instantly gain 70% extra ATK, which is great for her DPS.

C4 - Fractured Flow

Effect

Enhances the effects of the Passive Talent Return to Oblivion: Each Death's Crossing stack also increases Skirk's ATK by 10%/20%/40%.

You must first unlock the Passive Talent Return to Oblivion.

Importance

High

C4 Skirk will gain up to 40% extra ATK when stacking her fourth Ascension passive in Genshin Impact . While it’s not comparable to the extra DPS Skirk gets from her first and second Constellations, an unconditional extra 40% ATK is still a decent DPS win for Skirk in Genshin Impact .

C6 - To the Source

Effect

Each Void Rift Skirk absorbs via the effects of the Passive Talent Reason Beyond Reason will grant her 1 Havoc: Sever stack. She can consume such stacks to initiate coordinated attacks and decrease the DMG she takes while in Seven-Phase Flash mode. These stacks last for 15s, and each stack's duration is counted independently (max 3 stacks).

You must first unlock the Passive Talent "Reason Beyond Reason."

Havoc: Sever

  • When Skirk uses the Elemental Burst Havoc: Ruin, she will consume all Havoc: Sever stacks to initiate a coordinated attack in which each Havoc: Sever stack will deal 750% of Skirk's ATK as Cryo DMG. This DMG is considered Elemental Burst DMG.
  • When she uses Normal Attacks while in Seven-Phase Flash mode, 1 Havoc: Sever stack will be consumed when her third or fifth sequenced attacks hit an opponent to launch 3 coordinated attacks. Each coordinated attack deals 180% of Skirk's ATK as Cryo DMG. This damage is considered Normal Attack DMG.
  • When Skirk takes DMG while in Seven-Phase Flash mode, 1 Havoc: Sever stack will be consumed to decrease this DMG instance by 80% and attack nearby opponents 3 times, with each attack dealing 180% of Skirk's ATK as Cryo DMG. This DMG is considered Charged Attack DMG.

Importance

Priority

C6 Skirk becomes an arsenal of Cryo attacks whenever she attacks or enemies dare to attack her. When she absorbs a Void Rift, Skirk gains a Havoc: Sever stack, allowing her to later consume it and deal tremendous DMG in various ways.

She can cast her normal Elemental Burst, dealing extra massive DMG for each one of her Havoc: Sever stacks. Skirk can also use her Normal Attacks, which will consume Havoc: Sever stacks to deal extra DMG. The first two methods are the ideal ways to consume Skirk’s Havoc: Sever stacks since they scale with her Elemental Burst DMG and Normal Attack DMG, which is her preferred type of DMG.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Roblox: Terminal Escape Room Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Terminal Escape Room is perhaps one of the most challenging games you will find on the Roblox platform. This is because each level contains intricate puzzles that players need to solve. And sometimes, it is extremely difficult to do without hints. Fortunately, a way to get them for free is using Terminal Escape Room codes.

Unlike in most other experiences, these codes will not give you new items or currencies. Instead, players can receive something more substantial, namely hints. However, codes are active for a limited time, so you should hurry to use them.

Updated June 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: A pair of fresh hints just dropped to help you make your way through Terminal Escape Room more smoothly. These latest additions offer valuable clues that can guide you past tricky puzzles. They’re a useful boost if you’ve been stuck on a challenge. We’ll keep tracking new hints as they arrive, so be sure to revisit this guide often for more ways to escape.

All Terminal Escape Room Codes

Working Terminal Escape Room Codes

  • GIFT4U - Redeem this code to get a hint. (NEW)
  • FULLCIRCLE - Redeem this code to get a hint. (NEW)

Expired Terminal Escape Room Codes

  • thumbnailcode - Redeem this code to get a hint.
  • COMINGSOON - Redeem this code to get a hint.
  • Mastermind - Redeem this code to get a hint.
  • escape - Redeem this code to get a hint.

Terminal Escape Room challenges players to find their way out of different rooms. It is much more difficult than just finding a key or code since you will need to solve puzzles, some of which are confusing. However, the developers expect you to be stumped sometimes, so they added hints. One of the ways to get them is by using Terminal Escape Room codes.

By redeeming codes, you will receive hints for free and can use them later for the puzzles. However, it is important to note that codes expire after a certain time. Therefore, you should use them as quickly as possible.

How to Redeem Terminal Escape Room Codes

Fortunately, using Terminal Escape Room codes is as easy as in other Roblox titles. To do this, you just need to make a few clicks:

  • First, of course, launch Terminal Escape Room.
  • Then, spawn in the lobby and press the C key to open the code redeeming window.
  • Enter the code and click the Submit button.
  • If it is still active, you will see a successful redeeming message.

How to Get More Terminal Escape Room Codes

The further you progress, the more difficult the puzzles will become, and you will need as many hints as possible. Therefore, we recommend that you book this guide so as not to miss new Roblox codes. We will update this article, like other code guides. At the same time, you can visit the developers' social media to get codes and news first-hand:

  • CCF Studios Discord Server
  • CCF Studios Roblox Group
Roblox - Game

item.title: 5 Mistakes Players Make With Skirk In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Skirk

Cryo

Sword

Region

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Skirk is a Cryo Main DPS in Genshin Impact . Since her debut in the game, Skirk has been doing amazing, setting new standards for DPS units. While she didn’t introduce a new Element, she’s a nice introduction to the Nod-Krai atmosphere and what players should expect from that region.

Although it’s difficult for Skirk to make mistakes with how simple her gameplay is, there are still some complex mechanics that could lower her DPS during combat. Players who got their hands on the new, shiny Cryo DPS don’t want to make these mistakes when using Skirk in Genshin Impact .

5 Playing the Wrong Team

Stick With Cryo And Hydro

Teaming Skirk with the right characters can be tricky, as many of her abilities rely on having Hydro and Cryo characters in her team . When it comes to building her team, a lot of players might treat Skirk as a classical Cryo DPS that needs to trigger Reverse Melt to deal DMG.

The main idea behind teaming Skirk with Hydro and Cryo units is to increase her DPS from her own passive talents. It’s hard for other characters that are not Hydro or Cryo to compensate for the DPS loss. Only a character like Kazuha can replace a Cryo or Hydro unit because of his amazing Cryo buff and debuff.

4 Not Understanding Her Role

Main DPS Who Uses Normal Attack

It’s safe to say that Skirk is one of the best 5-star characters in Genshin Impact . Her DPS is insane, even without having a single unit in her team. Not to mention, her best team consists of characters like Furina, Escoffier, and Shenhe. All of them are units that give Skirk a huge buff while they can handle their off-field DMG themselves.

On the other hand, when Skirk is not teaming with these top-tier characters, it’s important to understand that her main role is a driver for her team’s Elements. Characters like Xingqiu or Yelan shine when paired with her because of her ability to drive their off-field DPS while dealing her high Cryo DMG. So, even if Skirk is doing great right now, when the next powercreep inevitably hits, players should be ready to play her role more effectively.

3 Upgrading Her Normal Attack

Like Master, Like Disciple

Since Skirk heavily relies on her Normal Attack DMG for her DPS, a lot of players might think it’s a good idea to level up her Normal Attack talent. However, this is not where she gets her DMG from. Just like Tartaglia, Skirk infuses her Normal Attacks with Cryo DMG when she casts her Elemental Skill. She will also get an entirely new scaling, including Normal Attack scaling. Because of that, it’s a priority to level up her Elemental Skill .

Players should also maximize the level of Skirk’s Elemental Burst as she deals a lot of DMG from this talent. Most importantly, it’s safe to neglect her Normal Attack talent, as it’s just Skirk’s Physical Normal Attacks when her Elemental Skill is not active.

2 Not Knowing Her Two Elemental Burst Versions

She Can Be A Burst Bot

When you Tap Skirk's Elemental Skill, she enters Seven-Phase Flash mode and gains 45 Serpent's Subtlety. Here, her Normal and Charged Attacks will be infused with Cryo, and her hits consume Serpent's Subtlety. Her Elemental Burst turns into Havoc: Extinction for the purpose of buffing her Basic hits. She exits the Seven-Phase Flash state after its duration ends or once she runs out of Serpent's Subtlety points. Since her Burst switches to the second version when she's in main DPS mode, she can't use her Burst to deal damage .

Skirk's Elemental Burst, Havoc: Ruin , is the one that can deal damage. To cast it, players must have at least 50 Serpent's Subtlety outside her Seven-Phase Flash mode . This can be done by:

  • Hold Elemental Skill to gain 45 points.
  • Hold Elemental Skill to absorb Void Rifts. Each Rift grants 8 points.

To maximize Skirk's Burst DMG, she needs 62 points , which is easy to do as you simply need to Hold Elemental Skill when there are three Void Rifts on the field . This will grant her 69 points. Void Rifts will appear when nearby party members trigger Frozen, Superconduct, Cryo Swirl, or Cryo Crystallize reactions .

Because Skirk needs to cast her Hold Elemental Skill to use her Havoc: Ruin Burst, she can't enter Seven-Phase Flash mode to perform as the main DPS and must wait until her Elemental Skill cooldown ends.

1 Not Taking Advantage of Her Best Artifacts

Don't Be Afraid Of The Restrictions

It’s easy to consider building Skirk with the Finale of the Deep Galleries set, since everybody knows that this set was made for her. That’s true; Skirk does get a lot of extra Normal Attack DMG, alongside extra Elemental Burst DMG. However, she can’t get both at the same time. When using her Normal Attack DMG, Skirk loses her Elemental Burst buff for a few seconds, and vice versa.

However, this is fine as you can't deal Elemental Burst DMG and Normal Attack DMG at the same time anyway . (Except at the start of battle when her Ultimate is ready.)

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Deltarune: How to Get All Grand Photos in Chapter 3
item.description:
Those who make it to Chapter 3 in Deltarune will eventually be tasked with finding Grand Photos. These Grand Photos are specific photo targets on the second board of the TV Time show.

While you only need three to progress, there are four in total, and getting all of them will help you achieve a higher score and potentially unlock secrets later. Some of the pictures are easy to miss, but this guide can help you find all the Grand Photos in Chapter 3 of Deltarune .

Just like all the round one in Deltarune Chapter 3, pay attention to the characters near the starting point as they can give you clues about where the Grand photos are.

Deltarune Chapter 3 Grand Photo #1

  • Clue: The plant of spikes, hides in the forest. It’s no rose, but its thorns hold love.

The first Grand Photo is of a Cactus in the Forest. To capture it, follow the steps below:

  • From the starting area, head one screen to the left and then down.
  • You'll find yourself in a vertical passage where a river runs through.
  • There will be a single cactus hiding on the right side in the trees. Take a picture of it.

Deltarune Chapter 3 Grand Photo #2

  • Clue: A green geyser, just next door. Who can dig it up?

The second Grand Photo is of The Geyser. Capturing it involves Lancer in Deltarune . Here’s what you need to do:

  • Move down from the starting point, keeping to the right side.
  • You'll find a vendor selling Lancer for a high price (999 points).
  • Use your camera to take a picture of Lancer. Make sure to include the price in it. Doing so will cleverly reduce the price to just 9 points.
  • Buy Lancer.
  • Now, return to your starting point.
  • Go through the door on the right of the starting area. Lancer will then start digging up.
  • Finally, take a picture of the newly revealed green geyser.

Deltarune Chapter 3 Grand Photo #3

  • Clue: A flower torn in half! I wonder who took it... the photo, I mean.

The third Grand Photo is of A Flower Torn in Half . To capture it, follow the steps below:

  • From the room at the beginning, go right and take the raft towards the dock at the bottom.
  • Hold off until Susie finishes solving the bridge puzzle in Deltarune . She’ll then ask you to solve the next one by yourself.
  • After fixing the bridges, head northeast from there, and snap a picture of a golden half-torn flower .

Deltarune Chapter 3 Grand Photo #4

  • Clue: The red antlion, under the ground. Fangs of youth, unearthed with a photo.

The fourth Grand Photo is of The Red Antlion . Here’s how you can capture it:

  • After you've taken the 3rd Grand Photo, move upward and head left . Here, you’ll find a simple puzzle.
  • Shift the two bridges on the sand tile to create a path leading to an underground cave.
  • Hit the button, and Susie will take over and trigger the bombs.
  • This will show a room below where antlions are moving around.
  • Hold off until a red antlion appears and quickly take a picture of it to get the final Grand Photo.

While you only need three to progress, getting all four Grand Photos is a major contributor to achieving an S-Rank in the photography round of TV Time. Earning an S-Rank for the round will also reward you with the White Ribbon. It also gives you access to the S-Rank Door in the Green Room, which leads to a hidden area in Chapter 3.
